column1: - Take medicines to reduce your cholesterol.
- Eat non-fat or low-fat dairy products, such as skim milk and low-fat yogurt.
- Avoid foods that contain high levels of sodium (salt).

These may include: - ACE inhibitors - Beta-blockers - Calcium channel blockers - Diuretics (water pills) - Statins to lower cholesterol - Nitroglycerin pills or spray to stop an angina attack To reduce the risk of a heart attack, you may also be told to take aspirin, clopidogrel (Plavix), ticagrelor (Brilinta) or prasugrel (Effient) every day.
Stopping these drugs suddenly or changing your dose can make your angina worse or cause a heart attack.
